description: Covered entree dish, number is worn; oblong with shell and gadroon edge, crested cover
inscription:
Inscription

On each side of the cover are engraved the arms of Cust quartering Brownlow and two others.  Inside the dish are the crests of the two families, while the finial is formed as the Brownlow crest, on a chapeau guille turned up ermine a greyhound satatant guille.
markings:
Maker, date, sterling, and London marks, crest engravings + GARRADS/Panton Street/ LONDON, then \"4\" on all parts

Fully marked on outer side of entree dish, on inside of cover, and on removable finial.  Stamped on underside of base: [GARRARDS/ Panton Street/ LONDON]. Underside of finial, interior edge of entree dish, and outer rim of cover marked with number [4].
title: Covered warmer
